    • Method Detail

      • asHashMap

        public static <TKey,TValue> HashMap<TKey,TValue> asHashMap(Object... keyAndValueArr)
        Convenience method to call asHashMap2(List).
        See Also:
        asHashMap3(List, List), putKeysAndValues(Map, Object...)

      • asHashMap2

        public static <TKey,TValue> HashMap<TKey,TValue> asHashMap2(List<?> keyAndValueList)
        Creates a new HashMap from a list of keys and values. Duplicate keys are not allowed.

        If you want to convert many arguments to a List, see Arrays.asList(Object...).

        The name of this method is set to prevent accidental method signature conflicts with asHashMap(Object...) and asHashMap3(List, List).

        Parameters:
        keyAndValueList - list of references: key, then value (repeat). Keys or values may be null. List may be empty.
        Returns:
        new HashMap reference with key-value pairs inserted
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if keyAndValueList is null
        IllegalArgumentException - if keyAndValueList.size() is not even, or a key cannot be cast to type TKey, or a value cannot be cast to type TValue, or a duplicate key exists
        See Also:
        asHashMap(Object...), asHashMap3(List, List), putKeysAndValues2(Map, List)

      • putKeysAndValues

        public static <TKey,TValue> Map<TKey,TValue> putKeysAndValues(Map<TKey,TValue> map,
                                              Object... keyAndValueArr)
        Convenience method to call putKeysAndValues2(Map, List).
        See Also:
        putKeysAndValues3(Map, List, List), asHashMap(Object...)

      • putKeysAndValues2

        public static <TKey,TValue> Map<TKey,TValue> putKeysAndValues2(Map<TKey,TValue> map,
                                               List<?> keyAndValueList)
        Adds key-value pairs to an existing Map reference. Duplicate keys are not allowed.

        If you want to convert many arguments to a List, see Arrays.asList(Object...).

        The name of this method is set to prevent accidental method signature conflicts with putKeysAndValues(Map, Object...) and putKeysAndValues3(Map, List, List).

        Parameters:
        map - reference to add key-value pairs
        keyAndValueList - list of references: key, then value (repeat). Keys or values may be null. List may be empty.
        Returns:
        input reference
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if map or keyAndValueList is null
        IllegalArgumentException - if keyAndValueList.size() is not even, or a key cannot be cast to type TKey, or a value cannot be cast to type TValue, or a duplicate key exists
        See Also:
        putKeysAndValues(Map, Object...), putKeysAndValues3(Map, List, List), asHashMap2(List)

      • asHashMap3

        public static <TKey,TValue> HashMap<TKey,TValue> asHashMap3(List<?> keyList,
                                            List<?> valueList)
        Creates a new HashMap from two lists: keys and values. Duplicate keys are not allowed.

        If you want to convert many arguments to a List, see Arrays.asList(Object...).

        The name of this method is set to prevent accidental method signature conflicts with asHashMap(Object...) and asHashMap2(List).

        Parameters:
        keyList - list of references for keys. Keys may be null. List may be empty.
        valueList - list of references for values. Keys may be null. List may be empty.
        Returns:
        new HashMap reference with key-value pairs inserted
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if keyList or valueList is null
        IllegalArgumentException - if keyList.size() != valueList.size(), or a key cannot be cast to type TKey, or a value cannot be cast to type TValue, or a duplicate key exists
        See Also:
        asHashMap(Object...), asHashMap2(List), putKeysAndValues3(Map, List, List)

      • putKeysAndValues3

        public static <TKey,TValue> Map<TKey,TValue> putKeysAndValues3(Map<TKey,TValue> map,
                                               List<?> keyList,
                                               List<?> valueList)
        Adds key-value pairs to an existing Map reference. Duplicate keys are not allowed.

        If you want to convert many arguments to a List, see Arrays.asList(Object...).

        The name of this method is set to prevent accidental method signature conflicts with putKeysAndValues(Map, Object...) and putKeysAndValues2(Map, List).

        Parameters:
        map - reference to add key-value pairs
        keyList - list of references for keys. Keys may be null. List may be empty.
        valueList - list of references for values. Keys may be null. List may be empty.
        Returns:
        input reference
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if map, keyList, or valueList is null
        IllegalArgumentException - if keyList.size() != valueList.size(), or a key cannot be cast to type TKey, or a value cannot be cast to type TValue, or a duplicate key exists
        See Also:
        putKeysAndValues(Map, Object...), putKeysAndValues2(Map, List), asHashMap3(List, List)
